content: work a row of scs now then repeat row 2 so that you have two extra row before working row 3 and the button holes row 3 button holes are calculated for 23 total stitches if you have more you may like to use 4 buttons suggestions below** row 3 1 single_crochet *chain 2 skip next st single_crochet 9 repeat from * once chain 2 skip next st single_crochet in last st chain 1 turn row 4 skip 1st st *1 single_crochet in chain space single_crochet 9 repeat from * once 1 single_crochet in chain space single_crochet in last st fasten_off ** count your stitches after row 2 or 4 if you add row if you have more than 25 stitches i suggest using 4 buttons if you have exactly 25 follow row 3 above with 10 scs between holes for 4 buttons subtract 4 from your stitch total then subtract 2 1st and last st then divide the remainder by 3 to find out the number of stitches to work between button holes eg 29 4 2 = 23 23/3 = 8 almost so work 8 scs between the first 3 holes and 7 scs before the last one so row 3 for four button holes 1 single_crochet *chain 2 skip next st single_crochet 8 repeat from * once chain 2 skip next st single_crochet 7 chain 2 skip next st single_crochet in last st chain 1 turn and if you have say 31 stitches you will work 9 stitches instead of 7 or 32 stitches you will work 9 between 3 holes then 8 before the last etc finally work row 4 as above line up and sew on your buttons with the same yarn split in half if you find it too thick for your needle final steps attach straps attach your straps to the back of your top in line with the front a or cross them over at the back and attach on opposite sides b for the size xs/s attach behind wheel 3 and 6 for the other two sizes i suggest attaching between a b wheels 2 and 3 and 5 and 6 or 3 and 4 and 6 and 7 a b edging right side under right arm with your smaller hook and your chosen edge colour attach yarn to the right side of your top point c and chain 1 single_crochet in same space single_crochet in each st to the top of the first wheel chain 1 *single_crochet in next st and in each stitch to the top of the next wheel chain 1* repeat between * * over more wheels single_crochet in next st and in each st to the 1st strap turn your work 90 degrees and single_crochet in each st up the side of the strap and over to the front end of strap turn to work down and along the edge of your top to the start join with slip_stitch to 1st single_crochet fasten_off left side repeat
